title: Why does a gramophone horn have big grooves (not to be confused with the grooves on a record)? - Quora

response.answer_text: I doubt that there’s an acoustic reason. I could certainly see grooves as being decorative, or possibly structurally reinforcing for the heavy horn that’s hanging out in midair above the record. I’ve seen lots of fancy engraving on the horns, and while they make them look artistic, they’re almost certainly only decoration for that large metal horn surface that is the most prominent visible part of a gramophone (and possible selling point in the store?). If you could add a photo it’d be easier to comment.
